title: Ex-NBA star Dwyane Wade joins TNT, CBS as NBA, Final Four analyst
text:
CLOSE

Former NBA star Dwyane Wade has reached a deal with WarnerMedia and will appear on Turner Sports’ TNT as on-air commentator for NBA and college basketball programming.

But there’s more to Wade’s media deal than just another ex-athlete joining the TV studio.

Wade also brokered a deal to become a creative director of special projects for Bleacher Report, and Wade and his 59th and Prairie Entertainment production company agreed to a deal to develop sports, lifestyle and entertainment programming for WarnerMedia.

He made his debut Tuesday and will be a part of TNT’s Tuesday night coverage of NBA games. Wade will also contribute to Turner Sports’ and CBS Sports’ coverage of the men’s basketball Final Four.

"I’m thrilled and grateful to be joining the WarnerMedia family with many exciting opportunities ahead," Wade said in a statement. "I have great respect for TNT’s team of analysts and their longstanding commitment to quality sports coverage. After sixteen seasons in the NBA, I look forward to connecting with my fans in this new role and bringing my own perspective to the game I love."

Wade retired after last season — a 16-year career that included three NBA titles, 13 All-Star Games, eight All-NBA selections and a scoring title. He is one of the greatest shooting guards in NBA history and will be inducted to the Basketball Hall of Fame when he is eligible.

Late in the 2018-19 season, USA TODAY Sports caught up with Wade, and he reflected on his career and retirement from basketball.

Asked what he planned to do with his post-NBA career, Wade said, "I have no idea. I know I have a lot of kids. I have a beautiful wife (Gabrielle Union) who has a career. I know I’ve got a lot of business things I’m doing. From there, I’ll figure everything else out. It’s going to be different. It’s going to be tough."

Wade’s son, Zaire, attends Sierra Canyon (Chatsworth, California), and plays on the basketball team with LeBron James’ son, LeBron Jr.

It didn’t take long for Wade to figure out what he wanted to do, which is what he did on the court: entertain.

"Dwyane is a special talent," Jeff Zucker, chairman of WarnerMedia News and Sports, said in a statement. "He’s a transcendent star with a charismatic, engaging and thoughtful personality on and off the court. We’re thrilled to welcome him to the WarnerMedia family and we could not be more excited to partner with him on these special projects."

description: Three-time NBA champion and future Hall of Famer Dwyane Wade also will take on role with Bleacher Report in deal with WarnerMedia.
